name: Cashin, Skip
title: Founder and Owner
notes: Emmett 'Skip' Cashin III founded Cashin Company in 1995 in Burlingame, CA; grew it to 270 agents across seven offices in San Mateo County. Previously president of Fox & Carskadon, one of the nation's largest independent brokerages. Coldwell Banker acquired Cashin Company in 2010.

name: Desnoes, Peter Blaise
title: Chairman, President and CEO
notes: Born in Mineola, NY. BA in Philosophy from University of Arizona (1966). Spent 16 years at ABC, culminating as VP of Sales and Marketing for ABC television stations and as President/GM of WLS-TV Chicago (1979-1983). Founded Burnham Broadcasting Company in 1983 (owned network-affiliated TV stations); sold TV stations in 1994. CEO of iBeam Broadcasting Corporation (publicly-traded internet broadcast network) 1999-2002. Emmy Award recipient 1980; named one of Chicago's Ten Outstanding Young Men 1983.

name: Gould, Charles L. Jr.
title: Advertising Executive
ngos: United Way of Bay Area (volunteer since 1983); University of San Francisco Board of Governors; San Francisco Ad Club; California Newspaper Advertising Executive Association; Golden Gate Bridge Celebration Committee (1987)
notes: Born July 9, 1955 in New York City. BA from University of San Francisco (1978). Advertising executive at San Francisco Newspaper Agency since 1979. Member of the Olympic Club and Bohemian Club. Member of the Papal Visit Press Committee (1987).

name: Konetzni, Al Jr. (Ret.)
title: Executive Director (Foundation)
ngos: Dolphin Scholarship Foundation (board member since 2012); National Maritime Historical Society (board of trustees); United States Submarine Veterans, Inc. Foundation (Executive Director)
notes: Vice Admiral Albert H. Konetzni Jr., USN (Ret.). Naval Academy graduate 1966. Career nuclear submariner; commanded at all levels including Commander Submarine Force, US Pacific Fleet and Deputy Commander, US Fleet Forces Command and US Atlantic Fleet (2001-2004). Responsible for 160 ships, 1,200 aircraft, 50 bases and 133,000 personnel. Retired September 1, 2004. Post-retirement: President of West Valley Environmental Services LLC; SVP at Energy Solutions; VP at Oceaneering International. VADM Konetzni Submarine Squadron Fifteen HQ building dedicated in his honor at Guam (2019). Two Distinguished Service Medals, six Legions of Merit.

name: Leitstein, Robert M.
title: CEO and President of Department Stores Division
notes: Born January 27, 1937 in Yonkers, NY. BA from Hobart College (1958). Career in luxury retail: Bloomingdale's (1960-1968), VP at Neiman-Marcus Dallas (1968-1976), President of Robert Leitstein Associates (1976-1978), President and CEO of Gump's San Francisco (1979-1991), then CEO/President of Hallmark Cards department stores in Kansas City (from 1991).

name: Lington, Aaron Joseph
title: Professor and Coordinator of Jazz Studies
ngos: Little Village Foundation (Board President); Music in Place (Artistic Director)
notes: Grammy Award-winning baritone saxophonist and composer. BM from University of Houston Moores School of Music; MM and DMA from University of North Texas. Performed with San Francisco Symphony, Maynard Ferguson, BBC Radio Orchestra, Count Basie Orchestra, Doc Severinsen. 2003 Sammy Nestico Award winner; 2011 'Jazz Educator of the Year' by California Music Educators Association. Co-founder of the Bicoastal Collective jazz partnership.

name: McClatchy, William Briggs
title: Executive / Family Member
notes: Son of James Briggs McClatchy (1920-2006), fourth-generation leader of the McClatchy newspaper dynasty. William McClatchy is a fifth-generation member of the family that founded the Sacramento Bee in 1857. His grandfather Carlos McClatchy founded the Fresno Bee. His father James B. McClatchy served as chairman and publisher of McClatchy Newspapers.

name: McDowell, W. Patrick
title: Founder, Chairman and CEO
ngos: National Multi Housing Council (Vice Chairman); HUD Advisory Committee on Troubled Projects
notes: BA from Stanford University; MBA in Real Estate from UC Berkeley. Previously co-founded The Fox Group and Metric Realty (with Metropolitan Life), which invested in and managed over $4 billion in real estate assets comprising 400+ properties in 30+ states. Founded McDowell Properties in 2004 focusing on multifamily investment and development. Based in Miami, FL.

name: McKnew, Tom
title: Founder and Principal
ngos: NAIOP; ULI; Bay Area Mortgage Association (Past President); Pathway for Kids (nonprofit, San Francisco)
notes: Master's degree in Real Estate Development from USC; BS in Public Administration and Urban Planning from USC. Co-founder of US Realty Capital, a San Francisco-based commercial real estate capital markets firm with 30+ years experience. Previously at Arthur Andersen's real estate services group in Los Angeles, CBRE, and Pacific Union Realty Finance. Past President of Bay Area Mortgage Association (2000-2001). Licensed CA real estate broker.

name: Rendell, Kenneth W.
title: President
ngos: International Museum of World War II (Founder); Manuscript Society (Past President); International League of Autograph and Manuscript Dealers (Past President); Antiquarian Booksellers' Association of America (unanimously nominated President)
notes: Born May 12, 1943 in Boston area. World's preeminent dealer of historical documents, autographs, and letters, with galleries in New York City, Beverly Hills, and Tokyo. Began collecting documents at age 12; first catalog published 1959. Expert in forgery detection: exposed the Hitler Diaries forgeries, fake Jack the Ripper diary, Elvis Presley music manuscripts, and Mormon 'White Salamander' forgeries. Received special recognition from US Department of Justice for FBI assistance. Founded International Museum of World War II near Boston (12,500 artifacts). Authored 14 books. IRS and Society of American Archivists adopted his appraisal methodology as standards (1974).

name: Riehl, Donald R.
title: Principal and Owner
ngos: Urban Land Institute (Life Member, board of trustees; chairman of Real Estate Credit Task Force 1990-1991)
notes: MBA from Harvard Business School (1958). Began career at Oliver Tyrone Corporation in Pittsburgh. In 1969, founded D.R. Riehl, Inc., a commercial and industrial real estate development company based in San Francisco. Developed approximately 9 million sq ft of retail and heavy industrial real estate. Joined ULI in 1962; served on research, membership, finance, and executive committees; appointed life member of ULI board of trustees by late 1980s. Chaired ULI Real Estate Credit Task Force 1990-1991. Retired 2006.

name: Roberson, Thomas Chase
title: President/CEO
notes: San Francisco based. Attended Urban School of San Francisco and Town School for Boys (1979-1988). BS in Business (MIS concentration) from Boston University. Career includes technology consulting roles at Sephora, VP of web product management at BlackRock, director of e-commerce at Restoration Hardware, and senior web developer at Charles Schwab.

name: Schaaf, Robert E.
title: Reservoir Engineer and Expert Witness
notes: BS in Chemical/Petroleum Engineering from University of Southern California. 30+ years worldwide petroleum engineering experience in California, Texas, Gulf of Mexico, Colorado, North Dakota, West Africa, and Middle East. Held technical, operational, and managerial positions at Chevron (Area Engineer for LA Basin 1987-1989; Sr. Staff Engineer in Angola 1993-1997 coordinating $450M North Nemba project). Based in Huntington Beach, CA.

name: Sfarzo, Ronald A.
title: Composer, Producer, Keyboardist
notes: Bay Area musician and composer. Served as police officer in Menlo Park, CA before returning to music. Background in music retail (piano and keyboard); worked with Wurlitzer and Baldwin Piano. Arranger, composer, band leader, and multi-keyboardist. Featured in NAMM Oral History collection as the only interviewee who served as a police officer.

name: Sinclair, Christopher T.
title: Non-Executive Chairman
notes: Born September 5, 1950 in Hong Kong; raised in Mumbai, India. BA summa cum laude in marketing from University of Kansas; MBA from Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth (1973). Spent 15+ years at PepsiCo, rising to Chairman and CEO of PepsiCo (1993-1996); recruited Indra Nooyi. Also served as CEO of Mattel Inc. (January 2015 to February 2017) and Executive Chairman of Mattel (to May 2018). Non-executive chairman of Reckitt Benckiser since May 2018. Also served as director of Merisant Inc., Cambridge Integrated Services Group, and Scandent Group. NOTE: Listed as Christopher T. Sinclair in member list; public records show Christopher A. Sinclair with this biography.

name: Slusser, James W.
title: Founder
notes: MBA and MS in Publishing from Pace University; BS in Finance and Business Management from Franklin University. 25+ years as business leader and consultant with senior executive teams in Americas, Europe, and Asia. Held senior leadership positions in global marketing service, retail, and publishing companies across telecommunications, retail, financial services, automotive, agriculture, performing arts, pharmaceuticals, and consumer products industries. Founded Kurkuma in 2017 (Web3/iOS development, cryptocurrency consulting, marketing).

name: Solso, G. Bradford
title: Former Chairman and CEO (Cummins); Former Non-Executive Chairman (GM)
ngos: EARTH University (Board President); DePauw University Board of Trustees (past member); Ball Corporation (board member, lead independent director since 2003); American Energy Innovation Council; Initiative for Global Development; Brookings Institution
notes: Theodore Matthew 'Tim' Solso, born March 5, 1947 in Spokane, WA. BA in psychology from DePauw University (1969); MBA from Harvard University (1971). Joined Cummins Inc. in 1971; named Chairman and CEO January 2000; retired 2011. During tenure, Cummins sales grew from $6.6B to $13.2B. Joined GM board June 2012; named non-executive chairman January 2014 (succeeding Daniel Akerson); transitioned to lead independent director January 2016; retired from GM board June 2021. Received Ellis Island Medal of Honor (2008), Anti-Defamation League Man of Achievement Award (2007), International Executive of the Year from Academy of International Business (2007), Six Sigma CEO of the Year (2007). Named top-5 finalist for MarketWatch CEO of the Decade (2010). IndustryWeek Manufacturing Hall of Fame inductee (2013). Honorary doctorates from DePauw, Rose-Hulman, Franklin College, and EARTH University.

name: Stack, Geoffrey L.
title: Managing Director
ngos: Tejon Ranch Co. (NYSE) Board of Directors (until December 2024); Georgetown University Board of Regents; California Housing Council (board); National Multi Housing Council (board; past chairman); Urban Land Institute Foundation (former Chairman); Nancy and Geoffrey Stack Family Foundation (donated $5M to ULI Chair's Fund)
notes: Born September 16, 1943. BA from Georgetown University; MBA from Wharton School. Prior to real estate, worked as aide to US Senator Paul H. Douglas and served 3 years as USMC officer (Captain). Co-founded Sares-Regis Group in 1993; previously President of Regis Group (1977-1993). Responsible for all residential operations of SARES-REGIS, one of the largest real estate firms in the West. Based in Irvine, CA. Virginia political donation records indicate Democratic-leaning contributions.
